intro: Baikiaea insignis subsp. minor, commonly known as the minor baikiaea, is a small evergreen tree or shrub native to the tropical rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and contributing to soil fertility. Its seeds are often dispersed by animals, aiding in its distribution within the forest understory.
